Title: Evolving your RESTful APIs, a step-by-step approach
Description: Designing an intuitive, user-friendly RESTful API is a tough job. It might already be a massive task if it‚Äôs your first attempt. Planning for the lifecycle management of your API is likely to be an afterthought. But it‚Äôs possible anyway: in this post, I‚Äôd like to propose a no-nonsense approach to evolving your APIs, even if it was not planned. Title: pSYoniK - Software, Hardware and Tech
Description: Every online purchase nowadays requires an email address. Every organisation, company, form or review left online asks for your email address. This dark-pattern has become so ubiquitous that it has domesticated us and we gleefully provide it to anyone. However, just because someone asks for your email address, it doesn‚Äôt mean that they can protect it and along with it, access to a host of other accounts you might have. With this in mind, allow me to detail some of these risks as well as provide ways of mitigating them.

	Dieser Artikel ist auch auf deutsch erschienen.

During the pandemic, grocery delivery services gained popularity.
New players on the market offer delivery in under an hour.
One of them is Gorillas, which not only delivers apples and granola bars in 10 minutes, but just as quickly delivered the data of all its customers.
How could this happen? Unfortunately, it was once again much too simple. But let‚Äôs start at the beginning:
